trait.name: Telepathic Hub
entries: When the Lesser Mindwitness receives a telepathic message, it can telepathically share that message with up to seven other creatures within 600 feet of it that it can see.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage. if the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13) and must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: Eye Rays. The Lesser Mindwitness shoots one of the following magical eye rays at random, choosing one target it can see within 120 feet of it:

1. Aversion Ray: The targeted creature must make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

2. Fear Ray: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
3. Psychic Ray: The target must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

4. Slowing Ray: The targeted creature must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

5. Stunning Ray: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be yeeted {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

6. Telekinetic Ray: If the target is a creature, it must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the Lesser Mindwitness moves it up to 30 feet in any direction, and it is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the Lesser Mindwitness's next turn or until the Lesser Mindwitness is {@condition incapacitated}.

If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The Lesser Mindwitness can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

variant.name: Mindwitness Familiar
entries: Some Lesser indwitnesses can be bound to a worshipper of Cthulu, and are willing to serve these spellcasters as a familiar. Such Lesser Mindwitnesses have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The Lesser Mindwitness can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the Lesser Mindwitness senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. At any time and for any reason, the Lesser Mindwitness can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

monster.name: Ardent Psuedodragon
monster.languages: understands Common, Draconic, Ignan and Primordial, but can't speak

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The Ardent pseudodragon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The Ardent pseudodragon can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 feet of it that can understand a language.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Ardent pseudodragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The Ardent pseudodragon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the Ardent pseudodragon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the Ardent pseudodragon can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The Ardent pseudodragon sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light in an additional 10 ft..

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 ft. the Ardent pseudodragon moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4+2}) fire damage.

variant.name: Ardent Pseudodragon Familiar
entries: Some Ardent pseudodragons are willing to serve spellcasters as a familiar. Such Ardent pseudodragons have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The Ardent pseudodragon can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the Ardent pseudodragon senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the Ardent pseudodragon is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the Ardent pseudodragon's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the Ardent pseudodragon can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.
